Sends a request to client for shaking the player's camera (the effect won't be shown if the player has Camera Shake disabled in their [[Options#Accessibility|Accessibility settings]]).

== Syntax ==
:<code>camerashake add <player: target> [intensity: float] [seconds: float] [shakeType: CameraShakeType]</code>
:: Add the camera shake effect to a player.
:<code>camerashake stop <player: target></code>
:: Stops the camera shake.

== Arguments ==
{{argument|be=1|player: target|CommandSelector<Player>}}
: Specifies the player(s) whose clients are sent a camera shake request. If not specified, defaults to the command's executor ({{code|@s}}).
: {{arg desc|type=players|be=player}} Unlike in other command, this target selector can always target online dead players with <code>@e</code>.

{{argument|be=1|intensity: float|float}}
: Specifies the intensity of the camera shake.
: {{arg desc|be=float}} Should be between 0 and 4 (inclusive).

{{argument|be=1|seconds: float|float}}
: Specifies the duration of the camera shake.
: {{arg desc|be=float}}

{{argument|be=1|shakeType: CameraShakeType|enum}}
: Specifies the type of camera shake direction.
: Must be one of <code>positional</code> and <code>rotational</code>.

== Example ==
To perform a positional camera shake with intensity 0.25 for 5 seconds:
* <code>/camerashake add @p 0.25 5 positional</code>

To perform a rotational camera shake with intensity 0.25 for 5 seconds:
* <code>/camerashake add @p 0.25 5 rotational</code>
